SENT.plain: The neonate appears to be in a transitional stage of glucose homeostasis
Maturation of neonatal glucose homeostasis requires coordination of opposing hormonal, neural, and enzymatic controls
The vulnerability of the neonate to carbohydrate disequilibrium has been described by tracing the maturation of carbohydrate homeostasis physiologically
The many examples of neonatal hypoglycemia and hyperglycemia have been enumerated
Much information in recent years has increased our understanding of the mechanism of these conditions in the newborn
Continued research of the biochemical and physiologic bases for alterations of carbohydrate metabolism should further enhance our ability to diagnose and treat the neonate effectively
